postcontent:
Description
The Aero Precision AR15 Stripped Lower Receiver is the perfect base for your custom AR15 build. Machined to mil-spec dimensions, their lowers work with standard AR15 components and ensure the highest quality with a correct component interface.

Features:
Platform: AR15
Material: Machined from 7075-T6 forged aluminum
Coating: Matte black hard-coat anodized Mil 8625 Type 3 Class 2
Markings: "Cal Multi"
Works with standard AR15 components and magazines
Rear takedown pin detent hole is threaded for a 4-40 set screw
Weight: 8.35oz
Includes:
Stripped AR15 Lower Receiver
FFL Terms and Conditions
• Any items placed on the same order as a lower receiver will also be shipped to the FFL. If you would like additional items shipped to you directly, please place them on a separate order.
• Please enter your information or the receiving party's (the person that will be picking it up) information under "Recipient Name" while checking out. There will be a seperate field for FFL name, phone and zip code and we will obtain the shipping address directly from them.
• To expedite your order, please have your dealer email their FFL to us. If the dealer you are using to transfer a firearm has not sent us a currently updated FFL to put on file, there will be an extended period of time needed to process your order.
Email: REDACTED

There will be a 30% restocking fee on all lower receivers returned because of failed background checks. 
Federal law requires that you be 21 years or age or older to purchase a stripped receiver or frame. If a frame or receiver can only be made into a long gun (rifle or shotgun), it is still a frame or receiver not a handgun or long gun. However, they still are "firearms" by definition, and subject to the same GCA limitations as any other firearms. See Section 921(a)(3)(b). 18 U.S.C. Section 922(b)(1) makes it unlawful for a licensee to sell any firearm other than a shotgun or rifle to any person under the age of 21.

There is no A-frame front sight to obscure the field of view of the optical device. The M6A2™ rifle also features a longer midlength free float rail system with a removable return-to-zero top. Any M4 MIL Std 1913 accessory can be mounted to the rail, and because the rail has a monolithic profile, you can bridge devices from the receiver to the rail seamlessly. The longer rail also affords more 1913 “real estate” to mount your accessories.

postcontent: Seller Stock #: XM2796503 NO MAGAZINE SALES into NEW YORK CITY This listing is for THREE magazines. Hit Buy It Once, and you’re buying 3, not 1. Hit Buy It 3 times and you’re buying 9, and so on. Winning buyer, however, may take any number of extras we have available at the same per-mag price and with no additional shipping charges. Here are factory Walther Magazines to fit the popular SW99 Pistols that are a joint effort of Smith & Wesson and Walther. They are also identical to magazines issued in Walther models 990 and 990-L; and more recently in the Magnum Research MR Eagle Fast Action pistols chambered in .40 Smith & Wesson Caliber. Each magazine is actually manufactured by Mec-Gar of Italy and so marked; and that puts these factory Walther and S&W Magazines in the class with all the best magazines in the world. Importer on these was Walther Arms, a recently divested arm of Smith & Wesson. The reason we got these at a good price is, that the Smith & Wesson wing in Springfield MA and Houlton ME is giving way to Walther USA in Fort Smith AR. Manufacturer Mec Gar is the principal magazine supplier for Beretta, Browning, Kel-Tec, and Sig Arms, and wisely so. Their magazines are solid steel construction, superior springs, followers and floorplates. They free-fall eject like they’re supposed to; they lock the slide open when they’re dry like they’re supposed to, and most important, they work reliably. Construction is smooth finished blue steel bodies with steel springs. Cartridge followers are high impact black, red, or blue polymer, with slightly extended black polymer floorplates so that each magazine holds only 10 rounds of .40 Smith & Wesson or .357 Sig caliber ammunition, down only two rounds from standard issue magazines for the SW99 and its counterparts and competitors. Smith & Wesson Factory number is 19279; Walther number is 2796503; and Magnum Research number is FA4010. Some magazines may have the Smith & Wesson name on them, but they are the exact same magazine, whether they bear a Walther Banner or S&W logo. Buyers in areas where they are permitted may take four excellent condition Smith & Wesson number 19358 standard twelve rounder magazines for the same price as three of these tens. title: For Sale/Trade:  ***Heavily customize AR15***
postcontent: I have for sale or trade a custome built ar15 assembled from  high quality parts from suppliers you've come to know and trust in today's black rife dominated marketplace. I am seeking cash or trade for a new project. Because of recent ammo prices I've only managed to fire 153 pills down the tube with zero malfunctions, its been sighted in for 50 yards and is dead on accurate even with steel case or brass ammo (best accuracy with 55-68 grain bullets).  The upper is a 16" midlength made by balmetto state armory, the barrel is  1/7 twist light profile, cold hammer forged, mp inspected and double chrome lined for ease of cleaning and longer bore life. The BCG or bolt Carrier group is custom as well. The carrier itself is made from 8620 steel full auto profile with a Nickle boron electroless planting inside and out, the carrier key is properly staked with grade 8 bolts. The bolt head is 158 carpenter steel, mp inspected with a wolf extra power extractor spring. Charging handle is a bcm mod 3 extended charging handle. Hand guards are magpul moe with one 5 slot rail section, magpul scout light mount with mft tactical light clamp, and Bushnell TRCKR weapon light. Mft vertical grip. Magpul sling mount and ms3 sling. The upper also has a Bushnell red dot.  The lower is a Anderson manufacturing , the lower parts kit is from rock river arms, the buffer tube is milspec diameter with the mil spec water drain hole and dry film lube coated interior. The buffer is a spikes tactical h2 heavy tungsten powder buffer.  The lower is topped off by the new magpul SL stock &  magpul qd endplate. The trigger guard is a magpul moe and the pistol grip is a magpul k2 grip. I've invested a lot of time and money into this rifle so I'd like tosee it go to a good home in someone's collection.

Here is Tapco’s recent contribution to aftermarket accessories for the recently imported Zastava Yugoslavian 59/66 Rifles, SKS type; and these also work in the Norinco China and Russian rifles that came in 20 years ago and that are still viable and frequently traded. A 59/66 or SKS owner will need to remove the rifle’s 10 shot magazine completely, then reassemble it with no magazine in order to install this conversion. title: For Sale:  SKS Rifle Stock Tapco 6 Position Black Polymer Collapsible New with Picatinny Rail Forend type 56 59/66
postcontent: Seller Stock #: GRSTK66167 t is against the law to install this stock on an SKS type rifle that has been converted to detachable magazine in several jurisdictions of these United States. Photos show a specimen of Tapco’s graphite based polymer stock for SKS, type 56, or 59/66 rifles. Manufacturer is Tapco Industries of Kennesaw, Georgia. Construction is black graphite based polymer, with steel bolts and pins. Buttstock is 6 position collapsible or retractable, that brings the length of pull anywhere from 11 1/2 inches all the way to a fully extended 15 inches, measured from the trigger face to the end of the buttplate. Pistol grip is serrated type, with spring loaded steel floor plate that allows quite a bit of storage inside it. Forend area is serrated side on the lower, and serrated ported upper or gas tube cover that includes a 9 slot Picatinny optics or light rail. Replacement pricing on these stocks in many areas is upwards of $200. We’re offering the Tapco type 56 SKS stock and forend assembly in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates, for only $ 59.00. >>> Collapsible or folding stocks: these are not an issue in most jurisdictions. In some states, however, what we call "any two evil features" laws come into effect. It is against the law, for instance, to install a collapsible or folding stock onto a rifle or shotgun that has a detachable magazine in California, Chicago Cook County IL, Connecticut, District of Colombia, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, and New York. Say, for instance, Mr. Dwight Owens of Bakersfield owns a federal status C&R Chinese SKS Rifle manufactured in 1956. Dwight decides to convert it to accept a detachable magazine, harmless enough. Then he decides to put a collapsible Tapco stock on the rifle as well. Dwight will be in violation of California law and can be charged with a felony. Rifle & magazine not included. postcontent:
I am reposting my ad because I don't want to keep this in mysafe, while someone else can put it to use, and I am looking to give that person an honest and fair deal. I am looking to trade my SP101 Wiley Clapp with lots of extras. This is not your standard SP101; it has rear dovetail sights, a beveled cylinder, and then there'sthe beautiful wood panels. I really like it, and I am considering whether I should even get rid of it because it may come back to bite me, but I just don't see myself putting it to practical use for quite a while.  

I put in over $900 into the gun and accessories, but I am not asking what I paid. I put 25 rounds through it and cleaned it thoroughly, so It is in excellent condition. I am including everything in the pictures: Badger Custom rosewood grips, factory Ruger rubber grips with stippled and Ruger logo engraved wooden panels, Hogue rubber grips, 2 HKS speed loaders, 25 rounds of .38 Winchester White Box, a leather IWB holster, a suede IWB holster,an uncle Mike's Soft IWB holster, a Fobus OWB holster, box, and paperwork. I only want a fair deal, so make a fair offer. Don't ask how much I want for it  because of course I want as much as I paid, which will not happen. I encourage you to do some research, so we can have a close understanding in value. What do you think it's worth? What is your trade worth? I don't want to break the items up, but if you make a reasonable offer for one or more, I just might be willingto separate them. I put together a very specific list of what I am looking for in trade, so any offers other than what I am looking for will get a "no thanks."

title: For Sale:  AR15 Pistol 10.5" Full Float, Stainless Steel, Chrome Lined Barrel, Wylde Chamber .223/5.56 1:8 twist rate
postcontent:
I will sell this complete AR Pistol to an Arizona Resident only who has a Concealed Carry permit from AZ or ID. The buyer will be required to sign a Bill of Sale as well. I am the legal owner and want to ensure the buyer is legally able to own a firearm.

This AR Pistol was built by me from individual parts. The asking price only allows me to get my investment amount back. 

The upper receiver is from SAA and is MIL-SPEC 7075-T6 Forged Aluminum, M4 feed ramps and is Mil-A-8625 Type 3 Class 2 Black Hard coat Anodized Finish. The Bolt Carrier Group (carrier and bolt) is Nickel Boron. The charging handle is standard make from SAA. The Barrel is 10.5", is stainless steel and has a chrome bore. The barrel has a WYLDE chamber which is specially made for both .223 and 5.56NATO rounds. The twist rate is 1:8. The compensator is from Kineti-Tech and reduces the recoil and barrel climb which enables the firer to stay on target with each shot. The Hand guard is a Full Float Yankee Hill Lightweight series 9.675" in length. The gas block is Aluminum and the gas tube is carbine length at 9.75".

The lower receiver is an Aero Precision "PEW" lower which is forged MIL-SPEC 7075 T-6 Aluminum and is Mil-A-8625F Type 3 Class 2 with a black hard coat anodized finish. The lower parts kit is Aero Precision as well. The grip is a soft rubber MagPul with a storage compartment for batteries and hex wrenches, or ????. The Mag Well Grip (MWG) is a FAB Defense. The safety selector lever is ambidextrious. The pivot and take down pins have large gripping ends and is laser engraved with the "Gadsden Snake" and say "Don't tread on Me". The trigger guard is made for gloved finger and is laser engraved with the "Gadsden Snake" and says "Give me Liberty or give me Death" The buffer tube is made specially for the Sig Brace and the Sig Brace is a Gen I. The buffer is a special 4.5 oz make and the buffer spring is stainless steel.

The Holographic Sight is a Sightmark SM 14003 Ultra Dual Shot Pro Spec NV compatible sight with a quick attach/detach mount. This holographic sight also has a red laser attached.

The overall length of this pistol is 26 3/4 inches and is measured from the end of the lower receiver extension to the last thread of the barrel. It is measured in a straight line, along the barrel, from one end to the other. Some of you will now why this is a important measurement.

Who ever purchases this firearm will, upon payment, receive a special personalized gift commitment from me.

The laser engraved ejection port cover has a waving American flag and the word VETERAN on both sides. This can be changed if you, the buyer, are not a Veteran. The alternative cover will be laser engraved as well. You'll have a few to choose from.

This pistol fires as good as it looks!!!!! I have about 200 rounds through it so it really isn't broken in yet......

The Sig Brace is a forearm brace and is not intended to act as a shoulder brace in any way, shape or form.........

Please, no low ball offers, no trades and no out of State sales. I will not ship it either. The sale will be made in person. My conditions for this sale are in the first paragraph, and are final, and I will not change my mind. Please be respectful. 

Thank you for looking at this very quality built AR15 pistol.........
